section.title: &kw-hos-tm; &kw-hos-version-50;: Increasing the Swift Node Timeout Value

sidebar.para: On a heavily loaded Object Storage system timeouts may occur when transferring data to or from Swift, particularly large objects.
The following is an example of a timeout message in the log (/var/log/swift/swift.log) on a Swift proxy server:
sidebar.screen: Jan 21 16:55:08 helion-cp1-swpaco-m1-mgmt proxy-server: ERROR with Object server 10.243.66.202:6000/disk1 re: Trying to write to /v1/AUTH_1234/testcontainer/largeobject: ChunkWriteTimeout (10s)
sidebar.para: If this occurs, it may be necessary to increase the node_timeout parameter in the proxy-server.conf configuration file.

sidebar.title: Increasing the Swift Node Timeout Value
sidebar.para: The node_timeout parameter in the Swift proxy-server.conf file is the maximum amount of time the proxy server will wait for a response from the account, container, or object server. The default value is 10 seconds.
In order to modify the timeout you can use these steps:

listitem.para: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/swift/proxy-server.conf.j2 file and add a line specifying the node_timeout into the [app:proxy-server] section of the file.
